data.title: Knightsville Veterinary Clinic
data.text:
Knightsville Veterinary Clinic is proud to serve Summerville, SC, and surrounding areas. We are dedicated to providing the highest level of veterinary medicine along with friendly, compassionate service.

We believe in treating every patient as if they were our own pet and giving them the same loving attention and care. We are a group of highly trained, experienced animal lovers who are devoted to giving our patients the best care possible.

Dr. Stephen Green

Dr. Stephen Green grew up in Summerville and graduated from Summerville High School. He then attended the University of Florida for his undergraduate degree. He went on to veterinary school at the Tuskegee University where he met his future wife Dr. Sheri Wagner Green. He established a veterinary clinic in Ladson, South Carolina, and practiced there, with his wife, for more than 20 years. He and his wife then opened this practice in October of 2007. Dr. Green is a conversationalist who enjoys spending time with clients. He and his wife like to travel and go horseback riding in their spare time.

Dr. Sheri Wagner Green

Dr. Wagner Green grew up in West Virginia and graduated from West Virginia University. She attended veterinary school at the Tuskegee University where she met her future husband, Dr. Stephen Green. After graduating she joined her husband at their practice in Ladson, South Carolina. They then opened this practice in October of 2007. Dr. Wagner Green is a breast cancer survivor. She enjoys cooking and spending time with her family. She and her husband travel and go horseback riding together.

Dr. Keith E. Blum

Dr. Blum grew up in Dillon, South Carolina. He attended Clemson University and then went on to veterinary school at Ross University. He completed internships in small animal medicine, surgery and emergency medicine. He and his wife have 2 children, 3 dogs, a cat, and Rhode Island Red chickens.

Dr. Adam Wagner

Dr. Wagner is the nephew of the Drs. Green. He grew up in West Virginia and attended undergraduate school at West Virginia University. He graduated from Mississippi State University’s Veterinary program in 2017 and came to work for us at that time. He is married has a dog, Remi, and a cat, Mikey.

Laura Murray

Practice Manager

Laura was born and raised in the Charleston area. She attended Clemson University and completed her bachelor’s in Biology at the College of Charleston. She began working for the Greens when she was in high school and has been the practice manager here since the clinic opened in 2007. She and her husband have a daughter, Abby, and 3 dogs, Rudy, Willow, and Walter.

Jessica Braun

Assistant Manager/Veterinary Technician

Jessica joined us in 2016 and has been in the veterinary field since 2009. She is originally from Connecticut and moved to South Carolina in 2012 to escape the cold. Jessica has two dogs, Gracie a rescue Springer Spaniel and Champ a Golden Retriever/Shepard mix, and a cat, Gris. Jessica enjoys spending time with her husband, walking her dogs, going to the beach, and enjoying sites around Charleston.

Moriah Rowland

Assistant Manager/Receptionist

Born and raised in Summerville, SC, Moriah began her animal career as a kennel technician and branched into animal medicine after working in a local animal shelter. Moriah now works in reception where she loves to help owners with their pets. In her free time Moriah loves anything to do with hunting hounds. Moriah is married and lives in Moncks Corner with her Boykin Spaniel, Marion Lakelynn, French Bulldog, Ozzie Albies, and her clan of hounds.

Christie Gates

Licensed Veterinary Technician

Christie is a licensed veterinary technician. She grew up on James Island. In 2002 she graduated from the Trident Technical College’s Veterinary Technology program. Her husband retired from the Air Force in 2018, they moved back to the Charleston area and she joined our team. They have 2 sons and 2 dogs.

Trinity Page

Veterinary Technician

Trinity, a lowcountry native and cancer survivor (in remission for 7 years!), joined our team in 2023. She has an associate degree in Veterinary Technology from Trident Technical College. Reading, fishing, hiking and watching anime are just a few of her hobbies. She has 2 dogs, Jasper and Isabella, and 3 rescue cats, Prince Vageta, Bagerra, and Chloe.

Maria Holmes

Veterinary Assistant

Maria grew up in the Myrtle Beach and Summerville area. She has always loved animals but found her true passion working at Knightsville Veterinary Clinic. She has 2 dogs and enjoys watching romantic comedies.

Courtney Stanfill

Veterinary Assistant

Courtney started at our clinic in March of 2020. She was born and raised in the Summerville area. She has a son in the United States Army. She also has cats named Hazel and Scarlett.

Lili Jones

Veterinary Assistant

Lili is a Summerville native who recently found her love for veterinary medicine. Lili has worked as a receptionist and is now exploring new tasks as a veterinary assistant. Lili has two rescue dogs, Nadia and Max. She also has Nova, a crested gecko and Maze, a Chinese cave gecko. Lili is fluent in Spanish which is a great asset to our practice.

Kimberly Stobbe

Veterinary Assistant

Kim has always known she wanted to work in the veterinary field, and had some experience under her belt before coming to work for us in July of 2022. When she’s not working, she’s spending her time with her son and their six beloved pets.

Connie Blair

Veterinary Assistant

Connie joined Knightsville Veterinary Clinic in early 2023 after moving to Summerville from her home town of Pittsburg Pennsylvania. She has always wanted to work with animals and is studying to become a licensed veterinary technician. When she is not working or studying, she enjoys reading and tending to her 2 dogs, Lincoln and Shadow, and cat, Aspyn. She also shares care of 4 senior dogs- Ryder, Ellie Mae, Badger, and Hunter.

Julie Cmil

Veterinary Assistant

Julie is originally from New Jersey and moved to Summerville in 2020. After undergoing cancer treatment in 2021 she decided to pursue her dream of working with animals and is currently enrolled in Trident Technical College’s Veterinary Technology program. She enjoys spending time wither dog, Jordan, and her two ferrets, Bandit and Skittles.

Delaney Phipps

Veterinary Assistant

Delaney was born and raised in the Ridgeville/Knightsville area. Her love of animals originated when she was born and grew as she did. Currently she is the pet parent of 2 ½ horses (2 full size and 1 mini), 2 dogs, 2 cats, and a herd of goats. Her passion for animals made her career choice of being a veterinary assistant an easy one.

Mia Hanlon

Receptionist

Mia was born and raised in the Summerville area and joined our team in June of 2022. She graduated from Trident Technical College with an Associates in science in 2014. Mia has a 14-year-old cat named Salem, whose nickname is “Fuzzy Buddy “and a society finch named Speckles. She has always loved all animals, especially Pugs. Mia enjoys drawing, writing, reading, playing video games, and spending time with her boyfriend.

Jennifer Cardona

Receptionist

Originally from Georgia Jen moved to Summerville in 2019. Jen has an enormous heart for animals and is ecstatic to have the opportunity to work with all pet patients and their parents. Jen and husband have a daughter, a rescued Weimaraner named Deja, and several rescued cats.

In Loving Memory of Mandy Carpenter

11/18/82 – 11/26/15
